intro: Porroglossum sororcula, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The showy yellow flowers appear in the spring and attract various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
